text: David Alejandro Green Casaya (December 4, 1960 â€“ January 29, 2022) was a Nicaraguan-born American Major League Baseball player. He played outfielder and first baseman. Between 1981 and 1987, he spent parts of six seasons in the MLB. He was a member of the St. Louis Cardinals for five of those years, and he also spent one season with the San Francisco Giants. Green died from heart failure caused by COVID-19 on January 29, 2022 at a hospital in Atlanta, Georgia at the age of 61. ==References== Category:1960 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Atlanta Category:Nicaraguan people Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:San Francisco Giants players Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Sportspeople from Atlanta
title: David Green (baseball)
